page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: The Great Eastern Railway was formed in 1862 and in the Eastern Counties it developed fast lines to all the major towns of the area. In 1883 the Railway was empowered to build a branch line from Wickford to Southminster.The Southminster line was finished,opening for goods services in June 1889 and for passenger service in July 1889 with a limited Sunday service. Steam ended and services by diesel commenced in June 1956.In 1956 it was feared the line would be closed,and goods trafic ceased. In 1969 Sunday passenger services ended but were resumed in 1980 from late June until September. Work has now started on the electrification of the line from Wickford to Southminster.
